issue.title: Vert.x 4.3.3 fails if assertions are enabled with Netty 4.1.80.Final

repository.name: vert.x
repository.description: Vert.x is a tool-kit for building reactive applications on the JVM

issue.body:
### Version

Which version(s) did you encounter this bug ?

4.3.3, but likely any main too.

### Context

[Upgrading RESTEasy](https://github.com/resteasy/resteasy/pull/3231) to Netty 4.1.80 causes assertion errors due to https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/12709.

The [`io.vertx.core.http.impl.AssembledHttpResponse`](https://github.com/eclipse-vertx/vert.x/blob/master/src/main/java/io/vertx/core/http/impl/AssembledHttpResponse.java) implements the `io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpContent` which triggers the assertion error.

I do not know if this should be considered a Vert.x error or a Netty issue.

### Do you have a reproducer?

It's a larger reproduce, but if you clone https://github.com/resteasy/resteasy and run with:
```
mvn clean verify -am -Dsurefire.failIfNoSpecifiedTests=false -pl server-adapters/resteasy-vertx/ -Dversion.io.netty.netty4=4.1.80.Final -Dtest=SSETest#testSSE
```

### Extra

The stack trace when I enabled some better logging was:

body: All subclasses of `io.netty.handler.codec.http.FullHttpMessage` was affected. In our case it is `AggregatedFullHttpRequest`.
